section.title: Reading
section.p: Read the definition of Homomorphism in Section 15.4. Then read Section 15.5 of Applied Discrete Structures up to, but not including, subsection 15.5.2 Error Correction
Who is Richard Hamming and why am I asking you about him?

li.p: Suppose a two bit message is encoded into a six bit message using the function e(b_{1}b_{2})=b_{1}b_{2}b_{1}b_{2}b_{1}b_{2}. Can a single bit error be detected by this code? Can it be corrected?

Define the two functions \alpha: \mathbb{Z}_2{}^3\rightarrow \mathbb{Z}_2{}^4 and \beta :\mathbb{Z}_2{}^4\to \mathbb{Z}_2 by \alpha\left(a_1,a_2,a_3 \right) = \left(a_1,a_2,a_3 ,a_1+_2 a_2+_2a_3\right), and \beta \left(b_1,b_2,b_3,b_4\right)=b_1+b_2+b_3+b_4.
The values of \alpha\left(a_1,a_2,a_3 \right) and \beta \left(b_1,b_2,b_3,b_4\right) can be computed as matrix products. Determine the matrices.
Describe the function \beta \circ \alpha. Is it a homomorphism?
